page.title: 04Aughton Charity Litter Pick
page.content: In June 1985 a group of school children from Aston Comprehensive School joined in a sponsored litter pick in the Aughton area. It was to tidy up our area and also to help old people think differently about young people. They did this by finding sponsors from older residents to see how much litter they could collect in one large bag. It took place over two hours on a Saturday morning. Altogether they collected 37 large bags of rubbish and nearly Â£100 in sponsor money. The group of 23 children have decided that the money they have raised should go towards three causes: the Bradford fire disaster, the Ethiopian famine and the Brussels football disaster. Their efforts were also recorded in the local newspaper,"The Rotherham Advertiser".
